cells.data:
Subset $S \subseteq \mathbb{R}^n$, subspace if
$0 \in S$
$u,v \in S \implies u+v \in S$
$r \in \mathbb{R}, u \in S \implies ru \in S$

Matrix $A$
$S = null(A) = \{ x : Ax = 0 \}$
Showing $null(A)$ is subspace
$A0 = 0 \implies 0 \in S$
$Au = 0, Av = 0 \implies A(u+v) = Au + Av = 0$
$Au = 0 \implies A(ru) = rAu = r0 = 0$

If $B$ is a basis for $S$, then every vector $s \in S$ has a unique representation $Bc = s$ where $c$ is a constant vector of scalars

This allows us to find coordinates $c$ with respect to a basis
